intro: Tricalysia djurensis, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. Tricalysia djurensis thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular choice in tropical and subtropical gardens.
